title: 820-00239 Touchbar braindead...
message:
Hi 2informaticos 

Another touchbar that makes life interesting 

The board takes about 19.9V and 0.66A and CPU is getting hot , no activity on usb or external screen and no image on internal screen 
Some measurements:

PP3V0_G3H = 3V
PPVCC_S0_CPU = 1.098V
PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT = 0.6V
PP1V8_S0 = 1.8V
PP1V2_S0SW = 1.2V
PP1V0_S0SW = 1V
PP5V_S0_T139 = 5.12V
PP5V_S0 = 5.12V
PP3V3_S0 = 3.33V
SMC_PM_G2_EN = 3.4V
PM_PCH_PWROK = 3.31V
PP3V3_PMICLDO = 3.29V
PPBUS_PMIC = 13.03V
CPU_VCCST_PWRGD = 0.999V
S5_PWRGD = 3.25V
SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD 3.4V
ALL_SYS_PWRGD   3.33V

Absolutely no liquid damage or any other visible damage .... any ideas ? :)

title: 820-00239 Touchbar braindead...
message:
Check for USB activity and external video with the board alone on the desk.
Connect only charger and HDMI adapter to the board.

There should be some history fail...

title: 820-00239 Touchbar braindead...
message:
Did that , no activity on the usb or external video ... The only thing the client told me is that they managed to crack the screen and then bought a complete assembly and changed it .... after that they couldnt get any life from the computer after replacing the screen
...

title: 820-00239 Touchbar braindead...
message: Check for knocked off components, especially close to the screw holes...

title: 820-00239 Touchbar braindead...
message: No such luck .... 2 hours on the scope and not one component knocked off or even look out of order.....

title: 820-00239 Touchbar braindead...
message:
PLT_RST_L goes high?
I don't see any reason for BIOS corruption, but try it just in case.

title: 820-00239 Touchbar braindead...
message:
PLT_RST_L stable at 3.35V


Thanks for helping 2informaticos , it is appreciated .
